item.title: Gatwick airport 'meet and greet' boss made £1m by tricking holidaymakers with online images of a hospital car park 400 miles away... then dumping vehicles in muddy fields, court hears
item.description: Asad Malik, 37, and his firm London Parking Gatwick Ltd are accused of six counts of fraud over a year. Cars were joyridden and dumped in fields and at petrol stations in West Sussex.
item.content:encoded:
A Gatwick Airport parking scam saw customers duped out of £1million before their cars were joyridden and dumped in muddy fields, a court heard.

Asad Malik, 37, and his company London Parking Gatwick Ltd are accused of six counts of fraud over a period of a year.

Lewes Crown Court heard Mr Malik, of Crawley, convinced customers their cars would be safe by showing them a picture of Borders General Hospital car park in Melrose, Scotland 400 miles away.

They thought their vehicles were being kept safe with valet cleaning facilities and 24-hour CCTV supervision.

But in reality they were being driven illegally and dumped in fields in the Ifield area, at petrol stations and even a mosque near the West Sussex airport, the jury heard.

Mr Malik also left fake reviews on his own website so clients would trust him, jurors were told. He denies the charges against him.  

Richard Heller, barrister for West Sussex County Council Trading Standards, told the hearing that the cars were used for joyrides and to tow other vehicles before being parked in muddy fields unlocked or with the keys stuck to the windscreen in a clear plastic bag.

The jury were told cars were driven extra miles, returned dirty and damaged to their owners or not returned at all. 

Mr Malik, of Crawley, West Sussex, fraudulently claimed customers' cars would be kept secure and returned undamaged, he said.

He also told customers they had no right to complain after leaving the airport despite warnings from Trading Standards officers he was breaking the law.

Customers cars were used to drag other vehicles through mud, returned damaged and dirty and complaints were ignored, Mr Heller said. 

Richard Heller said Mr Malik and LPG were one and the same.

The websites operated by Mr Malik also included fake customer reviews, he added, saying: 'Their provenance must be regarded as somewhat dubious.

'Mr John Smith left a review in December 2014 in which he described how his 'experience with them was the most suitable one, as I paid very less there which was the around trip of taxi fare and got the full service both ends of my journey'.'

Several complaints were uncovered by Trading Standards Officers and more unhappy customers came forward during the investigation.

'In June 2016, Sylvia Goodman said her car was returned with a bent key, the language on the dashboard display was changed to one she didn't recognise, there was hardly any fuel left, it was dirty, the time had been changed and there was litter in the car including a Co-Op receipt for mini garlic naans,' Mr Heller said. 

The naan breads had been purchased four-and-a-half hours after she dropped her car off at the airport expecting it to be parked a few minutes drive away, the court heard.

'Which gives rise to the obvious question - where had it been in that time and why wasn't it taken to, and left at, one of the parking locations,' Mr Heller said.

Other drivers received parking tickets after their cars were left at petrol stations around Gatwick airport.

Another customer was forced to search through fields himself for his own car after London Gatwick Parking failed to return it.

'Christopher Allen, who used LPG's services in June 2016, returned to Gatwick expecting to have his car brought to him but despite several attempts to contact the company he could not do so.

'He describes how with the help of other passengers he managed to locate his car in a muddy field some five to six hours after he arrived,' Mr Heller said.

Trading Standards officers booked several mystery shopper test purchases for cars fitted with a tracking devices.

'The investigation revealed a multiplicity of dishonest practice, misleading claims and unfair commercial practices,' Mr Heller said.

Asad Malik and London Parking Gatwick Ltd deny six counts of fraudulent trading between October 2015 and August 2016. 

The trial at Lewes Crown Court in Brighton before Mr Recorder Anthony Chinn QC continues.

item.title: Alexa Chung makes a rare solo outing in NYC as she discusses falling in love with 'amazing, supportive' Alexander Skarsgard in unearthed interview
item.description: The 34-year-old was pictured on a solo dash through NYC on Tuesday, as she spent a rare afternoon in the city alone, following multiple recent sightings with the Drowners lead singer Matt.
item.content:encoded:
She was believed to have rekindled her romance with Alexander Skarsgard in March, but was seen holding hands with ex Matthew Hitt in May.

And Alexa Chung seems keen to keep fans guessing after an unearthed interview with Porter hears her talk about 'falling in love with Tarzan' for the first time.

The 34-year-old was pictured on a solo dash through NYC on Tuesday, as she spent a rare afternoon in the city alone, following multiple recent sightings with the Drowners lead singer Matt, her ex-flame from 2014. 

Alexa looked lost in thought as she stepped out in Manhattan this week, carrying a tan jacket over one arm as she maintained an air of typically-cool street style.

She paired a basic white T-shirt with straight leg jeans and leather lace-up ankle boots, carrying a cute white handbag for her essentials.

The fashionista clutched a water bottle, seeming to walk with conviction in the absence of any company.

Just last week, Alexa raised eyebrows on another casual outing with one-time boyfriend Matt.

Despite dating as long ago as 2014, the duo have remained the friendliest of exes, and are regularly seen strolling through the city together.

Alexa seemed to reference her split from the rocker in an interview with Porter this February, simultaneously heaping praise on Tarzan actor Alexander, from whom it was understood that she had recently parted ways.

'[My best friend] was there for the heartbreak years,' she told the magazine. 'I think we spent thousands of dollars on booze and eggs. Then I fell in love with Tarzan.'

Referencing Alexander again, she elaborated: 'He’s an amazing man, very structured, responsible and supportive. He’s very good at, not making me more grown up, per se, but at making me take myself more seriously.' 

Alexa and Alexander confirmed their split in July 2017, with friends claiming the separation was entirely amicable after two years together.

Yet pictures of them arriving into London together by Eurostar in March seemed to hint that they had reconciled, and her kind words about the actor have now added more fuel to reunion reports.

It was the same interview in which Alexa explored the idea of 'losing her lesbian virginity'.

The British model and fashion designer confirmed that she would not rule it out, even saying that she was not sold on the idea of marriage, or monogamy.

She said: 'I don’t subscribe to the fact that you need one man to be happy: I think it’s a really crappy, anti-feminist sentiment.'

item.title: A glimpse of the future? Dutch city to become first in the world to build habitable 3D printed houses to cut costs and make up for a shortage of bricklayers
item.description: The smallest of the first five houses to be put on the rental market in Eindhoven has already attracted applications from 20 interested families.
item.content:encoded:
A Dutch city is to become the first in the world to build habitable 3D printed houses to cut costs and make up for a shortage of bricklayers. 

The smallest of the first five houses to be put on the rental market in Eindhoven has already attracted applications from 20 interested families.

The development is known as Project Milestone and was set up by construction firm Van Wijnen to offer a solution to the lack of skilled bricklayers in the country. 

Eindhoven, which is also home to the prestigious Design Academy Eindhoven, is hoping to position itself as a specialist for concrete 3D printing.  

The first house is expected to complete in 2019 and will be a three-bedroom bungalow. 

This will be followed by four multi-level homes on the site in Meerhoven, a new region of Eindhoven located west of the city centre, near the city's airport. 

The Eindhoven University of Technology team, led by researcher Theo Salet, was also behind the world's first 3D-printed concrete bridge, built in late 2017.

Mr Salet said: '3D-printing of concrete is a potential game changer in the building industry.

'Besides the ability to construct almost any shape, it also enables architects to design very fine concrete structures.'

'Another important advantage is sustainability, as much less concrete is needed and hence much less cement, which reduces the CO2 emissions originating from cement production.' 

Only the exterior and inner walls of the first of the new homes will be made using the printer. But by the time the fifth home is built – comprising three floors and three bedrooms – it is hoped that the drainage pipes and other necessary installations will also be made using the printer. 

Rudy van Gurp, a manager at the firm, which is working in collaboration on the project with the Eindhoven University of Technology, believes 3D printed homes will become mainstream in the next five years.  

He said: 'I think by then about 5% of homes will be made using a 3D printer. In the Netherlands we have a shortage of bricklayers and people who work outside and so it offers a solution to that.

'It will eventually be cheaper than the traditional methods. Bricklaying is becoming more and more expensive. Alongside, bricks and the use of timber, this will be a third way, which will look like stucco [plastered] houses, which people like.'

item.title: Barcelona 'ask Monaco about £79m France star Thomas Lemar amid Chelsea and Atletico Madrid interest'
item.description: Barcelona have stepped up their pursuit of France star Thomas Lemar by asking Monaco to name their price for the forward, with reports in Spain claiming a deal could be struck for £79m.
item.content:encoded:
Barcelona have stepped up their pursuit of France star Thomas Lemar by asking Monaco to name their price for the forward.

And reports in Spain claim that any deal for the 22-year-old will set the Catalan giants back by £79million.

Lemar has emerged as one of the hottest prospects in world football and was a target for Arsenal and Liverpool last summer.


But Sport report that Barcelona have now moved towards the front of the queue for the Frenchman's signature.

They also claim that Chelsea and Atletico Madrid will rival Barca in an effort to prise him away from the south of France.

Lemar was a prominent member of Monaco's charge towards the Champions League semi-finals in 2017 in his breakout season.

But he struggled to replicate that form last year amid a succession of injury problems.

He found the back of the net just three times in 35 appearances last season.

Despite a struggle for consistency he has been named by Didier Deschamps in France's 23-man squad for the World Cup.

item.title: If you've got it, flaunt it! The RAUNCHIEST snaps of Love Island's ladies showcasing their curves in skimpy swimwear
item.description: The ladies of Love Island Australia have set pulses every night in their scantily clad displays.
item.content:encoded:
The ladies of Love Island Australia have set pulses every night in their scantily clad displays.

And there has been no shortage of the feisty females proudly parading their bikini bodies at the Majorca villa over the past week.

As Natasha, Millie, Tayla, Cassidy and Erin enjoy the Spanish summer Daily Mail Australia takes a look at some of their raciest swimsuit photos to date. 

Busty blonde business owner Natasha Cherie, 24, is another beauty who has proudly flaunted her physique in a high cut one piece online. 

In a recent snap shared to her Instagram page, Natasha is seen posing with a crimson one-piece swimsuit barely covering her ample assets and pert derrière.

A selfie previously shared by the glamazon shows her flaunting her slender figure in a black one piece, that also put a strong emphasis on her cavernous cleavage.

Brunette beauty Millie Fuller is another bikini fiend who knows just how to work in a tiny two piece.

No stranger to the sand and surf, the petite 24-year-old previously posted a photo of herself relaxing on a beach towel in a red and black bikini.

She also recently shared a snap of herself in a eye-catching yellow two-piece that accentuated her slender frame.

Perth-stunner Tayla Damir is another beauty who is not shy of showcasing her physique.

In photos shared on her Instagram last year, the 21-year-old proudly showed off her  body in a bright yellow two-piece bikini. 

Bartender Cassidy McGill, 23, similarity hasn't been shy when showing off her stunning physique in saucy swimwear.

Before entering the Love Island villa, the blonde beauty shared a series of Instagram, including a bathroom selfie showcasing her busty display in a black-and-white stripped bra.

Another snap of the stunner shows her wearing a tiny black bikini during a holiday to Cancún, Mexico in 2016. 

While her co-stars have previously boasted about their bodies on social media, Erin Barnett has shied away from posts like her co-stars, only showing off her bikini body Love Island.

There's been no shortage of sexiness from the pocket-sized stunner who recently flaunted her figure in a cleavage-baring swimsuit.

An honorable mention should be noted to recent evictee Kim Hartnett who had tongues wagging from the moment she walked into the Spanish Villa.

The 22-year-old single mother has proudly shown off her body in a series of eye-catching Instagram posts including white two piece that drew attention to her ample assets and pert derrière.

Meanwhile the latest female intruder Françoise has been impressing everyone with her bikini body.

item.title: Wizard of Oz's oldest living munchkin Jerry Maren dead at 98 following battle with dementia
item.description: The late star passed away at a nursing care facility in San Diego, California, last week, following an ongoing battle with dementia.The actor's funeral was held in Hollywood last weekend.
item.content:encoded:
The Wizard of Oz's oldest living munchkin Jerry Maren has died at the age of 98.

The late star passed away at a nursing care facility in San Diego, California, last week, following an ongoing battle with dementia.

The actor's family and friends gathered for his funeral at Forest Lawn in Hollywood over the weekend. 

Despite landing a number of small parts throughout his 70 years in showbiz, Jerry's most notable role was that of the 'oldest munchkin' in 1939 fantasy phenomenon The Wizard of Oz. 

Standing at 4ft 3in, Jerry was just 18-years-old when he starred as a member of The Lollipop Guild, alongside Jakob 'Jackie' Gerlich and Harry Earles, in the movie, which saw the late acting legend Judy Garland play leading lady Dorothy.

He went on to secure a number of uncredited roles, playing a gremlin in supernatural sitcom Bewitched in 1967 and an ape in 1968 cult classic Planet of the Apes. 

Jerry bagged his first supporting part in 1971 TV series Lidsville and boasted another title role in 1982 comedy series No Soap, Radio, which also starred Steve Guttenberg.

Jerry also had a walk-on role in an episode of Seinfeld 'The Yada Yada' and played a mime in the 2010-released comedy horror movie Dahmer Vs. Gacy, one of his final acting roles.

The long-time actor was bestowed the honour of a handprint and footprint ceremony at Grauman's Chinese Theatre in Hollywood in September 2013.

The privilege came six years after he appeared with six other Munchkin actors at the unveiling of a Hollywood Star for the Wizard of Oz Munchkins on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. 

Away from the spotlight, Jerry was married to Elizabeth Barrington for 36 years before she tragically passed away in 2011. 

His final Instagram post, shared in May 2017, was a black-and-white snap of the happy couple on their wedding day, alongside which Jerry wrote: 'Happy Aniversary my life long love. Rip.'

Jerry was also forced to use the social media site as a platform to dismiss reports he had died after he was the subject of a death hoax back in 2016.

item.title: House of Lordzzzz: Chief whip rebukes peers for falling ASLEEP in the chamber and demands they maintain 'standards'
item.description: Lord Taylor of Holbeach, the Government's chief whip, emailed peers to complain they have been loudly chattering and even dozing off rather than listening respectfully to the debates.
item.content:encoded:
Peers have been told off for falling asleep in the Chamber - and been warned they must stay alert and maintain 'standards'.

Lord Taylor of Holbeach, the Government's chief whip, has emailed all Tory peers to warn them that their conduct was not up to scratch.

He complained that peers have been loudly chattering on their red benches and even dozing off rather than listening respectfully to the debates.

He wrote: 'It has been observed by members of our house that, over recent months, conduct in the Chamber has not been of the standard we should expect.'

A list of the 'main transgressions' includes 'falling asleep in the chamber', 'audible conversations' and 'sedentary shouting', The Times reported.

The whips of the other main political parties have sent emails to Lib Dem and labour peers also delivering the stern warnings. 

A recent BBC documentary showed the Labour peer Lord Foulkes of Cumnock with his eyes closed an apparently asleep in the Chamber.

It comes as pressure mounts for ministers to abolish or drastically reform the unelected House of Lords.

Peers are paid £300 a day to turn up at the Chamber - regardless of whether or not they speak or vote in debates.

And the Chamber has been stuffed with some 778 unelected peers, making it one of the second biggest legislature in the world  after the People's Republic of China.

A Labour source said peers would be reminded of conventions but said there would be no mention of sleeping. 

They added: 'Sometimes they really are closing their eyes. Others are leaning into the monitor to hear more closely and it looks like they've keeled over.'

Willie Sullivan, Senior Director at the Electoral Reform Society, said: 'Despite the way it is treated by some members, the House of Lords is not some private members' club. 

'Afternoon napping in the chamber is probably not the best way to scrutinise legislation.' 

The rebuke follows weeks of noisy and angry debates on the Brexit Bill in the Chamber.

Remain-backing peers tables some 15 wrecking amendments to the crucial legislation in a bid to keep the UK in the EU customs union and single market after Brexit.

The fiery debates sparked verbal clashes between peers who desperately want the UK to stay close to Brussels and those who warned they were overstepping their authority to try to dictate to MPs the terms of Brexit.

It is not the first time that politicians have come under fire for dozing off while in a debate in Parliament.

Tory MP Sir Desmond Swayne fell asleep while his Conservative colleague Ken Clarke spoke during a debate on the Brexit Bill in January.

The Brexit-backing slumped into his seat with his head rested on his hand for a short period as Mr Clarke - a vocal Remainer -  discussed the EU charter of fundamental rights.

item.title: Rihanna, Sarah Paulson and Anne Hathaway compete for worst outfit at the Ocean's 8 premiere as they put on a bizarre parade of frock horrors
item.description: Rihanna, Sarah Paulson and Anne Hathaway competed for worst-dressed at the Ocean's 8 world premiere in New York City on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded:
They are three of the leading lights in the all-female reboot of the Ocean's franchise.

But Rihanna, Sarah Paulson and Anne Hathaway hit a style low point as they competed for worst-dressed at the Ocean's 8 world premiere in New York City on Tuesday, with an array of bizarre dresses taking centre-stage on the red carpet.

Singer Rihanna, 30, who plays technical genius Nine Ball in the film, put on a very quirky display in a shimmering asymmetric dress which featured out-there bell-shaped fringe detail, which covered her toned frame from view.

As well as swamping her figure, the outlandish gown featured extra material around the neck which almost obscured the Umbrella hitmaker's visage from view.

Her gorgeous legs were however on full display as the fabulous dress cut just around the knee and draped asymmetrically.

Throwing caution to the wind, the diva went with bold make-up look with smokey eyes and a deep berry lip.

Next up to join the worst-dressed parade was Sarah Paulson, 43, who plays Tammy, a suburban mum and Debbie Ocean's former partner-in-crime.

Grabbing attention on the red carpet, the blonde beauty slipped into a garish neon yellow frock with statement pearlescent tassels which made for a truly eccentric look on the red carpet.

Upping the ante for the offbeat look, the star accessorised with a matching neon bag.

Her blonde tresses were styled slicked back from her face while her pretty features were enhanced with a rich palette of make-up. 

Completing the frock horror parade was Oscar winner Anne Hathaway, 35, who plays celebrity Daphne Kluger in the film.

The brunette beauty covered her lithe frame in an tent-like halterneck dress with a white bodice and flamboyant oversized skirt.

Anne seemed keen to emphasise the extremely baggy skirt, which was decorated with black and yellow geometric patterns, and smiled as she fanned the material out.

Her brunette tresses were worn sleek and straight while her pretty features were accentuated with metallic shadow, feline flicks of liner and a sweep of peach blush. 

The trio joined actresses Cate Blanchett, Sandra Bullock, Mindy Kaling, Helena Bonham Carter, and Awkwafina to premiere the hotly-anticipated film.

After a three-year wait, the octet of Hollywood royalty looked proud to be finally introducing the heist movie at the global premiere, held at Alice Tully Hall in Manhattan

Ocean's 8 all-star female line-up sees Debbie Ocean (Bullock) - the estranged sister of Danny Ocean - attempt to pull of a $150 million heist at the Met Gala.

Cate Blanchett stars as Lou, Debbie's partner-in-crime, while Sarah Paulson plays Tammy, a suburban mom and Debbie's former partner-in-crime.

Mindy Kaling is along for the ride as Amita, a jewelry maker, while Awkwafina plays Constance, a thief.

Helena Bonham Carter also appears in the summer female blockbuster as Rose Weil, a fashion designer.

On the otherside is Anne playing Daphne Kluger, a celebrity and the target of the heist, whose assistant is James Corden (John Frazier).

It will also see cameos from Anna Wintour, Zayn Malik, Katie Homes, Serena Williams, Kim Kardashian, Kendall Jenner and Kylie Jenner. The movie hits theaters June 8

item.title: Police arrest two men and a woman over horrific burns suffered by seven-year-old boy who could be scarred for life
item.description: Owen Atkin, seven, suffered serious burns at a house in Sheffield, South Yorkshire following an incident. Police have arrested a 31-year-old woman two men aged 33 and 18.
item.content:encoded:
Three people including an 18-year-old man have been arrested after a young boy suffered horrific burns which could leave him scarred for life.

Owen Atkin, aged seven, is believed to have been scalded with boiling water while his parents had left him in the care of others.

He remains in hospital more than a week after he was burned so severely on his face and head that medics do not know whether his hair will grow back.

South Yorkshire Police say two men and a woman had been arrested following the incident on Sunday, May 27.

A 31-year-old woman and a 33-year-old man from Rotherham were arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child and an 18-year old man was arrested on suspicion of causing grievous bodily harm.

All three have since been released on bail as enquiries continue.

Owen’s father Paul Atkin said his youngest son had been in someone else’s care in Southey Green, Sheffield, South Yorkshire, when he suffered the burns last weekend.

The injuries are believed to have been caused by the contents of a boiled kettle.

A fundraising appeal to cover the family’s hospital costs and pay for a holiday for Owen and his elder brother, Lewis has passed the £3,600 mark, with nearly 240 people donating.

Mr Atkin, 36, said brave Owen is ‘getting back to his old self’, following a visit from Sheffield Wednesday legend Lee Bullen.

Anyone with information is asked to call police on 101 or Crimestoppers, anonymously, on 0800 555 111, quoting the incident number 34 of May 27.

item.title: Faryal Makhdoom shares snaps of Amir Khan's 'man cave' to Instagram... proving the couple to be united following cheating scandal
item.description: Taking to her Instagram page, the 26-year-old posted a clip of the boxer's new man cave, and photos of the renovations taking place at their Bolton home - despite recent allegations of his infidelity.
item.content:encoded:
Their relationship was rocked earlier this month when it was claimed the boxer had been unfaithful, just two weeks after the birth of their second child.

But Faryal Makhdoom proved to be united with 'cheating' husband Amir Khan on Tuesday, when she shared snaps of their developing family home with followers. 

Taking to her Instagram page, the 26-year-old posted a clip of the boxer's new man cave, and photos of the renovations taking place at their Bolton home - despite recent allegations of his infidelity. 

Faryal first shared a video of the 'boys room' in their house, complete with plush sofas, flat screen TV and even a cabinet containing all of Amir's trophies. 

Clearly proud of the luxurious new room, the New York captioned the clip: 'Boys room almost coming together', followed by the high-five and love heart emojis. 

She had also shared an image of their stunning new living room at the end of last month, just as the cheating claims began to surface. 

Standing by her man and their happy family life, she wrote in the caption: 'Our home is finally coming together'. 

Faryal is currently overseeing the high-end building and interior design work at their luxury Bolton pad, while Amir is exploring new training facilities in the States.   

However, the couple have been plagued with drama in recent weeks - with boxer Amir being caught on private dating app Raya last week, just days after claims he had been unfaithful first emerged.

On the software, the former world champion's profile has advertised his availability, where he joins an exclusive host of celebrities and high-profile singletons.

The father-of-two's profile image shows the Bolton native gazing fiercely at the camera, while showcasing his toned upper body as he goes shirtless. 

The page also displays Amir's age, Twitter handle, and place of birth, as well as where he currently resides. MailOnline has contacted Amir's representatives for comment.  

The sportsman - who welcomed his second daughter Alayna in April - has been met with a number of cheating allegations since he tied the knot to Faryal in 2013. 

During their tumultuous romance, Amir and Faryal temporarily split in August 2017, but reconciled just three months later.

His 26-year-old wife recently touched on 'enduring hardship' following his alleged night of passion with beautician Sophia Hammani, 22, last month. 

The day before, Faryal shared two quotes on Instagram which seemed to be thinly-veiled jibes at her husband, with the first – attributed to Imam Ali – reading: 'Enduring hardship is more rewarding then enjoying ease'. 

Faryal's second heartbreaking quote by the same Muslim cleric said: 'It may happen that you ask God for something and he does not give it you to you in order to endow you with something of better quality later.'

Just days before, it was claimed Faryal had confronted the beautician who slept with the boxer just 17 days after the arrival of their newborn. She texted Sophia Hammani after discovering her number on the I’m A Celebrity star’s phone.

She said: 'What a f***ing a**hole. He makes me sick. I cannot believe this man'. Sophia, 22, admitted she had spent the night with the boxer in his hotel room after they met at a London club earlier this month.

However, instead of being angry with her husband's lover, Hammani claims they had a 'sisterly chat' and Faryal forgave her for the fling.  

The boxing star rejected the claims as 'nonsense' on Twitter, saying she was simply a fan aggrieved when he wouldn't pose for a photo.

The former Olympic boxer - who also shares four-year-old Lamaisah with the brunette beauty - wrote on Twitter after the story broke: 'What total nonsense! She was wanting a pic but was told to leave by security due to her being too drunk. IMO that's the reason she sold a story.'

Amir added: 'Quite strange at the fact that there is no photos of us together. Supposedly, i gave her £20, is that all she's worth?' In the early hours of this morning, Faryal mysteriously tweeted 's*** happens' to her 217,000 followers.

item.title: Elsa Hosk puts on a stylish display in lime green blouse and Gucci fanny pack as she grabs a green smoothie in New York
item.description: Elsa Hosk made a bold statement in a lime green blouse and Gucci fanny pack on Tuesday as she sipped a green smoothie while out and about in New York's East Village.
item.content:encoded:
Elsa Hosk made a bold statement in a lime green blouse and Gucci fanny pack on Tuesday as she sipped a green smoothie while out and about in New York's East Village.

The 29-year-old supermodel was effortlessly stylish in the bright top and statement accessories as she enjoyed a healthy beverage while out and about in the Big Apple.

Elsa shielded her eyes from the sunshine with dark-framed sunglasses and carried minimal essentials in her high-end body bag - which retails at an eye-watering £795.

Elsa appeared to be enjoying a spot of downtime in her non-stop schedule as she rocked her bright green top with black chino trousers.

The Swedish beauty accessorised her look with red and blue striped loafer heels as well as her designer bag, sporting her dark thick-framed sunglasses against her flawless complexion.

Elsa sported only a classic pink lip-gloss to highlight her plump pout as she headed into the city, keeping her blonde hair scraped back in a centre-part up-do.

Elsa went solo for the low-key outing after stunning with a sharp black suit at New York's CFDA awards, flashing a hint of her toned abs in the sartorial look.

The Victoria's Secret star first rose to public attention after joining the iconic lingerie brand in 2011, earning her coveted wings four years later.

Since then she has modelled for brands such as Dolce and Gabbana, Anna Sui and Guess, and has walked the Victoria's Secret annual fashion show seven times.

Elsa has also been in relationship with entrepreneur Tom Daly, 30 since some time in 2015 when they were first linked together.

However despite their high profiles, the pair keep their relationship private, only occasionally appearing on each other's social media.

Earlier this year Elsa and Tom did team up to star in an advert for J Brand jeans, larking about and giving each other piggyback rides in the light-hearted video.

item.title: Selma Blair shows off her slender legs in kooky boho mini as she head out for coffee and ice-cream run in LA
item.description: The 45-year-old Cruel Intentions star stuck her tried-and-tested flirty style, as she nailed the boho look in an intricately embroidered mini with pumps
item.content:encoded:
She has been spotted spending time with a mystery man for the past few weeks.

Yet Selma Blair was flying solo on Tuesday as she headed out for a coffee and ice-cream date without her rumoured new beau.

The 45-year-old Cruel Intentions star stuck to her tried-and-tested flirty style, as she nailed the boho look in an intricately embroidered mini with pumps.

Selma looked stunning for her outing as she showed off her endless legs in the black mini which was perfectly designed to also show off her waist. 

She nipped in her middle with a stylish belt while also toting a teal coloured bag to ensure she had all her essentials to hand. 

The Cruel Intentions beauty added a superstar touch by just rocking a pair of sunglasses over her perfectly made-up face. 

Her newly-lightened hair was styled into loose waves to help perfect her over-all boho babe ensemble.   

Selma has been spotted out and about in LA several times in recent days.

Just on Friday, she reunited with her Cruel Intentions co-star Sarah Michelle Gellar for a Pink concert at the Inglewood Forum. Gellar brought along her 8-year old daughter Grace, and one of her friends, for the girls night out.

'We have big smiles cause we were together at @pink concert and loved every minute,' Selma wrote on Instagram.

'It was the most incredible show I have ever been to and my heart is still blown open by what this incredible woman and performer does on that stage and in her life. We love you Pink!'

Selma left her 7-year old boy Arthur at home for the night out. 

Arthur's father is fashion designer Jason Bleick. Selma and Jason split up in 2012 after two years together.

item.title: Angry pet owner chases after a dog thief until he flips his van before fighting him with a MACHETE and saving three stolen pooches
item.description: A pet owner has managed to save his three dogs from being stolen after chasing after the suspected thief's van before starting a street duel with him in Guangdong, China.
item.content:encoded:
A pet owner has managed to save his three dogs from being stolen after chasing the suspected thief's van and even starting a street duel with him.

The unnamed pet owner from southern China deliberately collided his car with the back of the suspect's van, causing the van to lose control and topple.  

He then pulled out what seemed like a machete and started fighting the thief, who was holding a wooden club.

The incident took place on a street in Shanwei in southern China's Guangdong Province on Monday, according to the police.   

The pet owner managed to save all of his three dogs.

The suspect, 44-year-old Xie, has been detained by the police on suspicion of theft. 

According to a police statement, the unnamed dog owner noticed his three dogs went missing at around 5am on the day.

After reviewing home security footage, he realised his pets had been dragged into a van by a man.

The owner immediately called the Luhe Police before driving his car to chase the suspect's Wuling minivan. 

After witnessing the car chase and street fight, onlookers called the police who arrived at the scene shortly after. 

The suspect was captured by police officers with the help of the pet owner and bystanders. 

Police also confiscated the tools believed to be used by the suspect to steal dogs, including lassos, a rod, a hammer and a butterfly catcher.

They also found four fake number plates in the suspect's van.

Suspect Xie is said to be from Sichuan Province in south-west China.

He has admitted to stealing dogs from the pet owner and is now detained in the police station. 

It is unclear whether the dogs Xie had stolen were to be killed and sold to a meat market or resold as pets.    

Every year, thousands of pet dogs are poisoned and stolen in China, and as many as 20 million dogs are killed annually to satisfy the dog meat industry.

During a separate dog-stealing case in eastern China's Hangzhou city last year, police found out that dog meat gang sold dead dogs to restaurants at the prices of 50 to 60 yuan (£5.6-6.8) each.

Also in late last year, Chinese police bust a gang based in central China that had sold nearly 200,000 poisonous syringes to dog thieves across the nation through social media network.

Wendy Higgins from Humane Society International UK said the practice of dog stealing is 'too common' in China as she called for more attention to it.

She said: 'It's a cruelty that very often sees people's beloved pets targeted, and the animals involved can suffer enormously.

'HSI's Chinese partner groups routinely find dogs and cats on meat trucks headed to slaughter who are clearly suffering toxic poisoning or who have died from poisoning before reaching their destination.'

The stolen pet dog's meat often ends up on the dinner table and their skin is used to make fashion accessories.

item.title: 'Stick to football, Sterling': Dele Alli captures hilarious moment as his England pal Raheem is hit in the face by a basketball at the arcade
item.description: Dele Alli has called for Raheem Sterling to stick to his day job after capturing his hilarious gaffe at the arcades. The duo were out and about as they tried to unwind ahead of the World Cup in Russia next week.
item.content:encoded:
Dele Alli has called for Raheem Sterling to stick to his day job after capturing his hilarious gaffe at the arcades.

With the World Cup just around the corner, some of the England squad are doing their best to unwind ahead of their trip to Russia.

After boasting about his basketball skills, Sterling was left red-faced after a ball caught him on the nose, filmed for all to see on Tuesday afternoon.


Ahead of the game with Costa Rica on Wednesday evening, the Manchester City star looked calm and relaxed as he practised his jump-shot, with team-mate Dele filming on from afar.

As he successfully scored his first two shots, the 23-year-old appears to get ahead of himself as his third goes horribly awry and hits the frame of the arcade machine.

Without having time to react, the ball bounces back towards Sterling and hits him square in the face, much to the delight of Dele and Co behind the camera.

Like any true friend would in the same situation, Dele proceeds to upload the embarrassing moment to his Instagram where all 3.5 million of his followers could watch Sterling's gaffe. 

Sterling will be hoping to redeem himself for the hilarious gaffe when England play at Elland Road on Thursday evening.

item.title: Sickening mass drunken brawl breaks out as 11 men and one woman kick and punch each other outside takeaway 'while police stand and watch' in Birmingham city centre
item.description: Frightened onlookers watch on as punches are thrown during the melee (pictured) in Birmingham city centre, with police officers accused of not intervening until after the fight was over.
item.content:encoded:
Shocking footage has emerged of a mass drunken brawl involving eleven men and a woman outside a takeaway as police officers 'stood and watched'.

Frightened onlookers watch on as punches are thrown during the melee in Birmingham city centre, with one man kicked in the head as he falls to the floor.

The man who recorded the footage claimed that the fight was so chaotic that eight police officers did not intervene until the brawl was over.

It was filmed by the passerby, who did not wish to be named, after he saw the violent fight unfolding outside Pit Stop Takeaway on Broad Street, Birmingham on Sunday.

The video begins showing the eleven men and one woman in the midst of a mass brawl as daylight begins to break.

The man who filmed the incident said: 'At least 8 police officers who were standing dormant too afraid to intervene.

'They only rushed in at the end of the fight - at which point many of the men had escaped and gone.' 

A bald man lies injured in the middle of the street as another male kicks him in the head.

A brunette woman wearing high heels desperately tries to lift the injured man off the ground.

However the other man continues to kick him and she starts screaming in terror.

Meanwhile several of the men around her hurl punches, push and and attack each other.

In the resulting chaos, the brunette women shrieks as she falls on to the ground on top of the injured male.

The video then shows men grabbing each other by the throat and punching one another by a parked taxi.

The brunette woman manages to pull herself but the injured bald male, who has been kicked in the head repeatedly, has trouble doing so.

He falls on the street and lies on the road amongst takeaway boxes and rubbish.

The footage then pans to a bearded man wearing a long sleeved t-shirt who is violently punching another male.

As the camera pans, we see the crowd of partygoers who have gathered to watch the mass brawl in front of them.

As the gang of men continue to hurl punches and hit another in the background, we see the bald injured male attempt to drag himself off the pavement and away from the brawl. 

The video cuts as a single policeman can be seen entering the scene. 

West Midlands Police have no record of the incident.
